sources.title: His First Command (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. His First Command is a mostly forgotten comedy action film that follows a young man who enlists in the army to get close to the daughter of a high ranking officer. On release there were a few sequences that featured color, but these seem to have been lost, and only a poor quality version of the film is available online.Â

metadata.Plot: Playboy Terry Culver meets Judy Gaylord, daughter of the commandant of the Calvary unit at a U.S.Army post. He falls in love with her, and joins the Army as an enlisted nom-com, thinking he will quickly be make an officer. He immediately raise the ire of all the non-coms and enlisted men, especially tough-Sergeant Westbrook. But he comes through with flying colors at the annual steeplechase, saves a young girl, Jane Sargent, from being over-run by horses, gets a a broken arm and a commission...and the Colonel's daughter.
metadata.Writer: Jack Jungmeyer, James Gleason, Gregory La Cava
metadata.Actors: William Boyd, Dorothy Sebastian, Gavin Gordon
